jsx.ui
Class Container

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      jsx.Configurable
          jsx.Source
              jsx.ui.Widget
                  jsx.ui.Box<Widget>
                      jsx.ui.Container
All Implemented Interfaces:
OnRender, OnStyle
public class Container
extends Box<Widget>

A base class for container widgets.

A container widget is a Widget that not only wraps a component that wraps an HTML containing element, but also contains other widgets whose underlying HTML elements are graphically contained by the HTML containing element wrapped by the component of the container widget.

A Container widget is Configurable and is also an event source which fires Widget.Event events. It is meanwhile an event listener that handles events fired from its underlying component.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org

Field Detail

LAYOUT

public static final Id<Container.Layout> LAYOUT

A global identifier for a configurable property of a Frame widget.

The identified configurable property of a Frame widget is a reference to a Container.Layout that graphically layouts the children of the container.

Since:
1.0

Container

protected Container(ObjectLike ini)

A typical constructor forcing constructors of subclasses to pass initializing data.

This constructor invokes the typical constructor of the superclass passing the specified initializing object as the argument, registers itself with the underlying component to listener a Render event if it has not been rendered. If the specified component is rendered, this constructor will force to layout in the end.

Parameters:
ini - The initializing object.
Since:
1.0
Method Detail

getContainer

public static final Container getContainer(Widget w)

Returns the container source object if this one is graphically contained by another widget.

The wrapped object of a widget must also be a widget. This method simply returns the configurable property CONTAINER of this widget.

The event queuing and dispatching mechanism of the superclass tries to dispatch an event fired from a widget also to its container by calling this method, if this source is graphically contained by another valid source and the event wants to bubble, that is, its Source.Event.BUBBLE configurable property is true.

Returns:
The value of the configurable property CONTAINER of this widget.
Since:
1.0

getLayout

public static final Container.Layout getLayout(Container c)

Gets the layout manager that graphically layouts the children of the specified container.

This method simply returns the LAYOUT property of the current container.

Parameters:
c - The current container.
Returns:
The layout manager of the container.
Since:
1.0

layout

public final void layout()

Lays out the children of the current container widget.

This method simply displays all the children of the specified container by appending them to the container widget in the same sequence as in the children list. It does nothing if the current container is not rendered or does not have a child. A subclass should override this method to provide a particular layout.

This method does nothing if the current container is not rendered or does not have a layout manager and children.

Overrides:
layout in class Box<Widget>
Since:
1.0

setLayout

public final void setLayout(Container.Layout ut)

Parameters:
ut - The new layout manager.
Since:

remove

public final boolean remove(Widget wt)

Removes a widget from the children list of the current container.

This method will force a layout for the current box if the children list has been changed.

Overrides:

onEvent

public void onEvent(Style evt)

Performs an action on the dispatched event.

This method asks the layout manager to layout this container for resizing if it has possibly been resized and has a layout manager.

Specified by:
onEvent in interface OnStyle
Overrides:
onEvent in class Box<Widget>
Parameters:
evt - The event dispatched to this listener.
Since:
1.0
